XX. THE SPORIERS AND LORIMERS. Christ with the Doctors in the Temple. Square brackets represent sections of text unclear or absent in the original and supplied by the current editor
[PERSONS OF THE PLAY. Jesus. Maria. Joseph. Primus, secundus, tertius Doctor. Primus, secundus, tertius Magister.]

[Scene I] The road from Jerusalem. 1. Jos. [M]arie, of mirthis we may vs mene, And trewly telle be-twixte vs twoo Of solempne sightis þat we haue sene In þat cite were we come froo. Mar. Sertis, Joseph, ?e will no?t wene What myrthis with in my harte I maie, Sen þat oure sone with vs has bene, And sene ther solempne sightis alswae. Jos. Hamward I rede we hye In all þe myght we maye, Be-cause of company Þat will wende in oure waye. 2. For gode felawshippe haue we founde, And ay so forward schall we fynde. Mar. A! sir, where is oure semely sone? I trowe oure wittis be waste as wynde, Allas! in bale þus am I boone, What ayleth vs both to be so blynde. To go ouere fast we haue be-gonne, And late þat louely be-hynde. Jos. Marie, mende thy chere, For certis whan all is done, He comes with folke in feere, And will ouere take vs sone. 3. Mar. Ouere take vs sone? Sir, certis nay, Such gabbyngis may me no?ht be-gyle, For we haue trauelde all þis day Fro Jerusalem many a myle. Jos. I wende he hadde bene with vs aye, A-waye fro vs how schulde he wyle? Mar. Hit helpis nought such sawes to saie, My barne is lost, allas! þe whille! þat euere we wente þer oute With him in companye, We lokid ouere late aboute, Full wooe is me forthy! 4. For he is wente som wayes wrang, And non is worthy to wyte but wee. Jos. Agaynewarde rede I þat we gang The right way to þat same citee, To spire and spie all men emang, For hardely homward is he. Mar. Of sorowes sere schal be my sang, My semely sone tille I hym see, He is but xij ?ere alde. What way som euere he wendis. Jos. Woman! we may be balde To fynde hym with oure frendis. [They turn back.

[Scene II] The Temple. 5. ius Mag. Maistirs, takes to me in tente, And rede youre resouns right on rawes, And all þe pepull in þis present Euere ilke man late see his sawes. But witte I wolde, or we hens wente, Be clargy clere if we couthe knawe Yf any lede þat liffe has lente, Wolde might allegge agaynste oure lawe. Owthir in more or lesse If we defaute myght feele, Dewly we schall gar dresse Be dome euery ilk a dele. 6. iius Mag. Þat was wele saide, so mot I the, Swilke notis to neven me thynke wer nede, For maistirs in this lande ar we, And has þe lawes lelly to lede, And doctoures also in oure degree, Þat demyng has of ilka dede. Laye fourthe oure bokes belyue, late see, What mater moste were for oure mede. iiius Mag. We schall ordayne so wele, Sen we all clergy knawe, Defaute shall noman fele Nowdir in dede ne sawe. [Enter Jesus. 7. Jesus. Lordingis, loue be with ?ou lentte And mirthis be vn-to þis mene. ius Mag. Sone, hense away! I wolde þou wente, For othir haftis in hande haue we. iius Mag. Sone, whoso þe hedir sente, They were nou?t wise, þat warne I þe, For we haue othir tales to tente Þan now with barnes bordand to be. iiius Mag. Sone, yf þe list ought to lere To lyve by Moyses laye, Come hedir and þou shalle here Þe sawes þat we shall saye; 8. For in som mynde itt may þe brynge To here oure reasouns redde by rawes. Jesus. To lerne of you nedis me no thing. For I knawe both youre dedys and sawes. ius Mag. Nowe herken ?one barne with his brandyng, He wenes he kens more þan we knawes! We! nay, certis sone, þou arte ouere ?inge By clergy ?itt to knowe oure lawes. Jesus. I wote als wele as yhe Howe þat youre lawes wer wrought. iius Mag. Cum sitte, sone schall we see, [Jesus sits among them. For certis so semys it noght. 9. Itt wer wondir þat any wight Vn-till oure reasouns right schulde reche. And þou sais þou hast insight, Oure lawes truly to telle and teche? Jesus. The holy gost has on me light, And has anoynted me as a leche, And geven me pleyne poure and might The kyngdom of heuene for to preche. ius Mag. Whens euere this barne may be That shewes þer novellis nowe? Jesus. Certis, I was or ?e, And schall be aftir ?ou. 10. ius Mag. Sone, of thy sawes, als haue I cele, And of thy witte is wondir thyng, But neuere the lesse fully I feele Itt may falle wele in wirkyng. For Dauid demys of ilka dele, And sais þus of childir ?ing, And of ther mouthes, he wate full wele, Oure lord has parformed loving. But ?itt, sone, schulde þou lette Here for to speke ouere large, For where maistiris are mette Childre wordis are no?t to charge. 11. And if þou wolde neuere so fayne Yf all þe liste to lere þe lawe, Þou arte nowthir of myght ne mayne To kenne it as a clerke may knawe. Jesus. Sirs, I saie ?ou for sartayne, That suthfast schalbe all my sawe, And poure haue playnere & playne to say, And aunswer as me awe. ius Doct. Maistirs what may þis mene? Meruayle me thynke haue I, Whens euere þis barne haue bene, And carpis þus connandly. 12. iius Doct. Als wyde in worlde als we haue wente, Itt fand we neuere swilke ferly fare, For certis I trowe þis barne be sente Full souerandly to salue oure sare. Jesus. Sirs, I schall proue in youre present Alle þe sawes þat I saide are. iiius Doc. Why, whilke callest þou þe firste comaundment, And þe moste in Moyses lare? Jesus. Sirs, sen ?e are sette on rowes, And has youre bokes on brede, Late se, sirs, in youre sawes Howe right þat ?e can rede. 13. ius Doct. I rede þis is þe firste bidding Þat Moyses taught vs here vntill, To honnoure god ouere all thing, With all thy witte and all þi will; And all thyn harte in hym schall hyng, Erlye and late both lowde and still. Jesus. ?e nedis non othir bokes to bring, But fandis þis for to fulfill. The secounde may men preve And clerly knawe, wher by Youre neghbours shall ?e loue Als youre selffe, sekirly. 14. This comaunded Moyses to all men, In his x comaundementis clere, In þer ij biddingis, schall we kene, Hyngis all þe lawe þat we shall lere. Whoso ther two fulfilles then With mayne and myght in gode manere, He trulye fulfillis all þe ten Þat aftir folowes in feere. Þan schulde we god honnoure, With all youre myght and mayne, And loue wele ilkea neghboure Right as youre selfe, certayne. 15. ius Doct. Nowe sone, sen þou haste tolde vs two, Whilke ar þe viij? can þou ought saye? [Jesus]. The iij biddis whare so ?e goo, Þat ?e schall halowe þe halyday. Than is þe fourthe for frende or foo, That fadir and modir honnoure ay. The vt e you biddis noght for to sloo No man nor woman by any way. The vjt e, suthly to see, Comaundis both more and myne, That thei schalle fande to flee All filthes of flesshely synne. 16. The vijt e fo[r]bedis you to stele ?oure neghboures goodes, more or lesse, Whilke faute? nowe are founden fele Emang þer folke þat ferly is. The viijt e lernes ?ou for to be lele, Here for to bere no false witnesse. ?oure neghbours house, whilkis ?e haue hele, The ixt e biddis take no?t be stresse. His wiffe nor his women The xt e biddis no?t coveyte. They are þe biddingis x, Whoso will lelly layte. 17. iius Doct. Be-halde howe he alleggis oure lawe, And lered neuere on boke to rede. Full subtill sawes, me thinkeþ, he saies, And also trewe, yf we take hede. iiius Doct. ?a! late hym wende fourth on his wayes; For and he dwelle, withouten drede, The pepull schall full sone hym prayse Wele more þan vs for all oure dede. ius Doct. Nay, nay, þan wer we wrang, Such speking wille we spare. Als he come late hym gang, And move vs nowe nomore. [Enter Mary and Joseph.] 18. Mar. A! dere Joseph, what is youre rede? Of oure grete bale no bote may be, Myne harte is heuy as any lede My semely sone tille hym I see. Nowe haue [we] sought in ilk a stede, Boþe vppe and doune, ther days thre, And whedir þat he be quyk or dede ?itt wote we noght, so wo is me! Jos. Mysese had neuere man more, But mournyng may not mende; I rede forther we fare Till God some socoure sende. 19. Aboute ?one tempill if he be ought, I wolde we wiste þis ilke nyght. Mar. A! sir, I see þat we haue sought! In worlde was neuere so semely a sight. Lo! where he sittis, ?[e] se hym noght? Emong ?one maistiris mekill of myght. Jos. Now blist be he vs hedir brought, For in lande was neuere non so light. Mar. A! dere Joseph, als we haue cele, Go furthe and fette youre sone and myne, This day is gone nere ilke a dele, And we haue nede for to gang hyne. 20. Jos. With men of myght can I not mell, Than all my trauayle mon I tyne, I can no?t with þem, þis wate þou wele, They are so gay in furres fyne. Mar. To þam youre herand for to say Suthly ?e thar no?t drede no dele, They will take rewarde to you all way, Be-cause of elde; þis wate ?e wele. Jos. When I come there what schall I saye? I wate neuere, als haue I cele. Sertis, Marie, þou will haue me schamed for ay, For I can nowthir croke nor knele. 21. Mar. Go we to-gedir, I halde it beste, Vn-to ?one worthy wysse in wede, And yf I see, als haue I reste, Þat ?e will no?t, þan bus me nede. Jos. Gange on, Marie, and telle thy tale firste, Thy sone to þe will take goode heede; Wende fourth, Marie, and do thy beste, I come be-hynde, als God me spede. Mar. A! dere sone Jesus! [They come forward. Sen we loue þe allone, Why dosse þou þus till vs, And gares vs make swilke mone? 22. Thy fadir and I be-twyxte vs twa Son for thy loue has likid ill, We haue þe sought both to & froo, Wepand full sore as wightis will. Jesus. Wherto shulde ?e seke me soo? Ofte tymes it hase ben tolde you till, My fadir werkis, for wele or woo, Thus am I sente for to fulfyll. Mar. There sawes, als haue I cele, Can I no?t vndirstande; I schall thynke on þam wele, To ffonde what is folowand. 23. Jos. Now sothely sone, þe sight of þe Hath salued vs of all oure sore; Come furth, sone, with þi modir and me, Att Nazareth I wolde we wore. Jesus. Be-leves wele, lordis free, For with my frendis nowe will I fare. i doct. Nowe, sone, wher þou schall bide or be, God make þe gode man euermore! No wondir if ?one wiffe Of his fynding be full fayne; He schall (and he haue liff) Proue till a praty swayne. 24. But sone, loke þat þou layne for gud or ill Þe note þat we haue nemed her nowe, And if it like þe to lende her stille, And wonne with vs, welcome art þowe. Jesus. Graunte mercy, Sirs, of youre gode will, No lenger liste me lende with ?ou, My frendis thoughtis I wol fulfille And to þer bidding baynely bowe. Mar. Full wele is vs þis tyde, Nowe maye we make goode chere. Jos. No lenger will we bide, Fares wele, all folke in feere. Jhc, Maria, Joseph, Primus doctor, secundus doctor, & tercius doctor.
